inlet.digest: Buffer to be given as argument

objarg.name: outnames
objarg.description: The outname attribute sets a name (or a wrapped list of names) for each of the buffer outles of the objects in ears. These names are only accounted for if the naming mode is 'Static'.

objarg.name: expression
objarg.description: The expression can contain variables, in the form $in, $rn, $fn, $xn, where n stands for an inlet number. $in will refer to an integer value extracted from the llll received in the n-th inlet; likewise, $rn will refer to a rational or integer value and $fn to a floating-point value. $xn will refer to an untyped value, meaning that the type of the value extracted from the llll will be taken as-is, including symbols (see the description of the llll method). Unless specific needs, $xn should be considered the preferred way to express variables. For a complete list of the mathematical operators and functions supported please refer to expr's help file.

method.name: (mouse)
method.description: Double-clicking on the object will open the display window for the output buffer(s). If more than 10 buffers are to be output, only the first 10 are displayed.

method.name: list/llll
method.description: A list or llll with buffer names will trigger the buffer processing and output the processed buffer names (depending on the naming attribute).

method.name: reset
method.description: If the naming attribute is set to 'Dynamic', the reset message will force the dynamic naming to cycle and restart from the first used name. This is especially useful in combination with iterative mechanisms.

method.name: writeaiff
method.digest: Save output as raw file with no header

attribute.name: naming
attribute.description:
Chooses the output buffer naming policy:
0 (Copy): the buffer name is copied from the input (in-place modification). This is only available for very few objects.
1 (Static): a single buffer (and hence buffer name) is created, and always used as output.
2 (Dynamic): a new buffer (and buffer name) is created for each new command. Beware! This may allocate a lot of memory! You can always cycle on a fixed set of names via the reset message.

attribute.name: normalize
attribute.description: Sets the normalization mode for the output buffer: 0 = Never, does not normalize; 1 = Always, always normalizes to 1.; 2 = Overload Protection Only, only normalizes to 1. if some samples exceed in modulo 1.

attribute.name: outname
attribute.description: Sets the name for each one of the buffer outlets. Leave blank to auto-assign unique names.
